sentence: Today's Research Daily features new research reports on 16 major stocks, including Berkshire Hathaway (BRK.B), Procter & Gamble (PG) and Statoil (STO).

Berkshire Hathaway shares have outperformed the Zacks Finance sector over the last few years and this trend has continued this year (the stock i sup +25.5% in the year-to-date period vs. +13% gain for the Zacks Finance sector).
Berkshire is more than just an insurance operator, but that business is no doubt at the core of this finance-centric conglomerate.
Insurers are as much beneficiaries of the post-election uptrend in long-term interest rates as traditional banks.
While the improving interest rate backdrop is a recent development, Berkshire has long history of prudent investments, a strong balance sheet and diverse business mix.
Concerns about Warren Buffet's succession and exposure to catastrophic losses on the insurance side are some of the major issues, according to the Zacks analyst.

(You can read the full research report onBerkshire Hathawayhere>> )

Procter & Gamble shares have lost ground lately, in line with the market's reduced affinity for consumer staples stocks in the post-election period.
That said, the stock has still outperformed the Zacks Consumer Staples sector in the year-to-date period.
The analyst likes the company's strong organic sales, which grew 3% in the reported quarter, the best performance in over two years.
Productivity improvements and aggressive cost-saving efforts have consistently improved margins with the trend expected to continue going forward.
On the flip side, the Zacks analyst points to mature end markets and the negative impact of the strong U.S. dollar as some of the headwinds for the stock.

(You can read the full research report onProcter & Gamblehere>> )

ADRs of Statoil , the Norwegian oil major, have outperformed the Zacks Oil & Gas Sector in the year-to-date period ( STO is up +29.1% vs. +23.3% gain for the sector).
Driving this outperformance is the company's active divestitures of non-core assets, like the recent sale of its interest in Kai Kos Dehseh oil sands projects in the Alberta.
The start-up of a number of major projects and efforts to broaden international assets are some of the other positives, though the outlook for production growth remains uncertain.

(You can read the full research report onStatoilhere>> )

Other noteworthy reports we are featuring today include Schwab (SCHW), Infosys (INFY) and Canadian National (CNI).

The Zacks analyst believes that the cancellation of Viacom's proposed merger with CBS is a major concern.
However, with Bob Bakish as new CEO, company could witness better future results.
The covering analyst thinks aggressive store expansion initiative will boost the performance of CarMax.
The company also enhances shareholder value through buybacks.
The Zacks analyst believes that E*TRADE 's ongoing restructuring moves and improving credit trends will aid its growth trajectory.
Moreover, growth in DARTs reflects improving trading activities.
The covering analyst is encouraged by the company's prudent cost management and its efforts to reward shareholders through dividends and share buybacks.
Cardinal Health is banking on strategic buyouts, joint ventures and expansionary moves.
However, the Zacks analyst expects intensifying competition and a tough pricing environment to mar prospects.
The covering analyst believes Target's dwindling top-line performance is a concern.

Total sales fell 6.7% in third-quarter fiscal 2016,

The Zacks analyst thinks Diageo's strategy of consistent product innovation helps it maintain dominance in the growing spirits industry.
The Zacks analyst thinks Schwab's growth looks impressive.
The current equity market volatility, supported by a continuous improvement in metrics should continue to drive up its trading volumes.
The covering analyst believes Juniper's frequent product launches, cost reduction initiatives, improving execution and expansion into the SDN segment is positive in the long haul.
The Zacks analyst feels that key products like Opdivo should continue to fuel top-line growth at Bristol-Myers.
The company's efforts to develop its pipeline are also encouraging.
The Zacks analyst thinks Lowe's has underperformed the Zacks Categorized industry in the past six months, primarily due to weaker-than-expected top and bottom line in the trailing two quarters.

Host Hotels' (HST) Growth Likely to Remain Limited in Q4

The covering analyst thinks though the special dividend declaration is positive, growth will likely be restricted in fourth quarter given the slump in business travel and election cycle.

Infosys (INFY) Stock Hit by Weak IT Spending and Soft Demand

Infosys is being hurt by the persistent decline in IT spending and weak banking related business.
Going forward, the U.S. election results are likely to exert pressure on the company's margins.
